intro: Parameconopsis cambrica, commonly known as the Welsh spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the United Kingdom. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Parameconopsis cambrica is a rare and protected species, often found in specific habitats across Wales.
